Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Marijke V
Reviews.Content: Agon hotel Franke is situated only 500m. from U-bahnhof Adenauer Platz. It has quite small but very clean rooms and is situated in a residential area. At night it is very silent, so you will get enough sleep. For the breakfast-buffet you have to pay an additonal 8 euro. For that amount of money you will get very fresh bread, and a large assortment of cheese and meat. When I get back to Berlin, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay forfßHisffsdgghsosgsig”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Cobb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in February. The hotel had many a positive and negative aspect to it: Positives: - Staff. They were all extremely friendly from the receptionist, the breakfast staff to the housekeeping ladies. All keen to help when requested and always with a smile. My German isn't the best either and so even though we tried the language most politely replied in English. - Location. Located in the Kurfustendam, the hotel had an ideal location for a wide selection of bars and restaurants yet it was set back a street from the hustle and bustle and so was still peaceful. It was only a 5 minute walk from the nearest U-bahn on which it only took ten minutes to get to the centre of Berlin. - Breakfast. The breakfast selection was plentiful. Their we're standard continental options such as breads, meets and cheeses. A range if cereals as well as cooked options everyday. Negatives: - Noise. When the hotel was constructed, I think they had a shortage of stone and so they made the walls with paper. I felt like we were sharing our room with the people next door who were keen on getting 'acquainted' reguarly. Probably not as keen once i'd told them to shut up :-) - Smokey. Since the smoking ban in the UK, we tend to take it for granted that places tend to smell fresh and you can leave a place not smelling musty. However, corridors were definetly smokey despite the no smoking signs. Something that my pregnant wife wasn't so happy about. All in all, we didn't pay through the roof to stay at the Franke and so didn't feel too aggrieved by the negative aspects above. If you are looking for somewhere not too expensive to use as a base for a trip to Berlin I would recommend the Franke. If you were more interested in luxuries I would advise looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Healsby
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and location was good for getting in and out of the centre of Berlin. Taxi was around 40 Euros from Schonefeld Airport. Bath was amazingly long and deep.

Reviews.Title: “Agon Franke”
Reviews.Author: hurstyv
Reviews.Content: Hotel in an easy walking distance from nearest u-bahn - needed a walk after a hearty breakfast. We were given a room on the 6th floor and upon opening the door we were knocked back by the smell of cigarettes, even with the window open it was unbearable. The lady on reception (who was smoking in the office) came out and gave us a new room on the 2nd floor without hesitation which was a much brighter, tidier room. There is a traditional German bar/restuarant on the corner on the way to the U-bahn called Xantener Eck, we had 2 delicious meals in there and sampled differant German beers, well worth a visit. All in all we had a nice time, the breakfast was well organised and plentiful even when we got there half an hour before serving times ended every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: pippikit
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Berlin, and the Franke was easy to reach on the 110 bus from Tegel airport. Clean and comfortable with a good shower, we were also pleased to have a free safe in the room. Staff friendly and helpful. We too recommend the buffet breakfast as good value for 8 euros. Only downside was some street noise on Saturday night. Easy to find public transport, U-bahn and buses, at Adenauerplatz a few minutes walk away.Get a Berlin Welcome Card if you plan to stay a few days, for travel and discounts. Nearby Xantener Eck bar and restaurant serves great German food.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Szilvia S
Reviews.Content: This is a simple hotel with a good location. The U-Bahn (underground) station Adenauer Platz is only a 5-minute-walk away. There is a Lidl and a Netto (cheap supermerkets) plus a beakery in a 5-minute-walking distance. The breakfast buffet is really good, lots of different kind of breads, sausages, cheese etc. You can reach the city center (Mitte) by the U-Bahn in about 40 minutes. The rooms are clean and well furnished and the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and welcoming hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: AndyVengeance
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Agon Franke in Berlin is a wonderful hotel for its star rating and price range. The location is perfect with only a 10 minute walk from Charlottenburg S-Bahn station and it is located in a quiet part of the city just off the shopping street of Kurfurstendamm. The staff were welcoming and there is 24 hour service on the reception desk and a safe in the room. The rooms are fairly basic but were very clean and are cleaned everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: annh44
Reviews.Content: Unlike many of the reviews we found the Agon Franke hotel to be just right for our needs. It was close to the main thoroughfare and convenient for buses and trains. Staff were courteous and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. The room was reasonably small but quite adequate and the bathroom appeared to be brand new. It was a pity there was no lounge but this is expected when paying this price for a hotel. no complaints at all

Reviews.Title: “well-positioned and great value for monwy”
Reviews.Author: Europhila
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated a mere five minutes from Adenauerplatz underground station, from where all parts of this great City are easily accessible. The hotel is clean, rooms are adequately furnished and towels and bedlinen regularly changed. Breakfast is excellent, and the staff accommodating, especially as we required an earlier breakfast then normal on our last day. Kurfurstandamm is a stroll away and offers plenty of places to eat; I recommend the Turkish Restaurant, "Tugra', which serves delicious, reasonably priced food in tasteful surroundings. Francucci's serves very good pizzas but beware the hidden 25% cover charge!! I would recommend this hotel, and this location to anyone on a modest budget.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep - but a little too far from the center”
Reviews.Author: xo919
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The staff was nice. The main problem with the rooms were the beds that weren't very comforetable. The way we see it, the main problem with the hotel was the location that while it is close to busses and subway station, at nights, when the frequency of those goes down, it becomes a husstle to leave the hotel and go out.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, better than its reputation.”
Reviews.Author: Anonima66
Reviews.Content: We needed two rooms, and booked the hotel due to the very low fees proposed. The first reviews were OK. After the booking we read very discouraging reviews that made us doubt our decision. We were glad we took the chance. The hotel is old, yes, but clean. The windows were new, insulating well from the cold and the little traffic from the street. At least two floors and the breakfast area were smoke-free. The breakfasts were OK and abundant. Personnel were helpful. No need to worry. Very good value for money here. Comparing it to a 3-star hotel from London, this is FAR better. Tips to walk less: To get here from the airport, get off at U-bahn Adenauerplatz and take the bus 110 towards U-Oskar-Helene-Heim one bus stop to Hochmeisterplatz.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johanna101
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet street, less than a kilometer away from Kudamm, where the nearest U-bahn stop is. However, there are only a few steps to the bus stop, and the bus takes you to the center. At this point of Kudamm, there are a couple of nice, decent priced restaurants but the action is nearer the center. The breakfast buffet was delicious and filled our stomaches till dinner. Tea, coffee, cocoa, different kinds of bread, toppings, cheese, juice, yoghurt, cereals, fruit etc. The room was clean and otherwise very nice, too. There was enough room for luggage. The toilet seat broke down, but it was fixed on the same day. However, not properly. The toilet didn't flush because the plastic flushing button was broken, but we were able to flush the toilet while the cover on the toilet seat was taken off. A minor thing but a bit irritating. There was a computer with internet in the lobby, however it didn't work and wasn't fixed during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are not very welcoming a bit tired looking but very clean breakfast very good”
Reviews.Author: dennyEngland
Reviews.Content: good selection, you can have as much or as little as you want. a little bit out of the way from the busy part of the city centre but within walking distance to the bus stop. would use this hotel again if they made an effort to brighton up the rooms and hall ways, both very dated and somewhat dinghy. Some members of staff seemed to find it very hard to be pleasant, the reception area was very basic and could have done with a good interior designer to take charge

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: orlile
Reviews.Content: good location. clean rooms. new showers. non smoking rooms at the second floor. a very kind and helpfull staff. good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Necator
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Agon Franke during a short leisure trip to Berlin. The hotel has a relatively good location, near Ku'dam, but still in a very quiet neighbourhood. When reviewing this hotel, it is necessary to take the price into account. Our double room was listed at 134 EUR/night. If we had paid that much, I would have been very, very dissapointed. However, we booked through a travel agent, and July was apparently not high season, so we paid less than a third of the list price. In that respect the hotel was ok for our purpose. However, I would definitively not recommend this hotel for business travellers. For that the room was a tad too small, there was no ironing board/trouser press in the room, no fridge/minibar and no air condition, so it got very hot. Not so much a problem when you are on an leisure trip, and walk around in shorts, but it would have been hell in a business suit. Pros: - Location - Price (the one we got at least) - Parking in the hotel courtyard, very convenient - Clean. Although the hotel is old and in need of renovation, the room was spotless, but that is pretty much the standard in Germany. Cons: - Breakfast buffet not very inspiring, and the staff did not refill it fast enough. Also, it was hard to get a table for breakfast, since the used tables were not cleared fast enough. - Noise travelled easily from room to room and floor to floor - Very hot (visited in July), especially the breakfast restaurant was like a baking oven. - Soft beds (but you can run into that on much more expensive/luxurious hotels also) Conclusion - I would recommend this hotel for someone on a budget leisure trip to Berlin, if they can get a similar discount. I would not use it when on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly hotel, old fashioned, would need renovation”
Reviews.Author: A-re-tsamaye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Agon Franke in July for a weekend trip to Berlin. When we arrived around 9 pm in the evening, staff at reception appeared to be a little annoyed by some guests arriving during an otherwise quiet Friday evening. The lady was a little unfriendly and not very willing to answer our questions about breakfast time and car parking. Parking is 5 EUR extra by the way, but it also is easy to find free parking lots at the roadsides in the area. Also we were asked to fill long registration forms including passport no, full address, full names and so on which is tedious and not usual anymore for German citizens in most hotels to fill in every single field in a registration form after we had booked with most information in the email booking already. Next day staff in the breakfast room and for check out was friendly. The hotel overall is very, very old. 60ties style but not vintage. It is the original old and neverr renovated interiors. The room was reasonably clean, the shower and toilet flush not working properly. Overall, a place to stay for a night just to get sleep somewhere but not a place to stay for enjoyable holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ollyholiday
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Berlin and stayed at Agon Franke. My first problem was my taxi driver (from the airport) had no idea of the hotel, I had to give him the street name before we could go anywhere, this was worrying. Once we finally found the hotel, I was incredibly disappointed. From the outside it looked like a shabby, run down, almost derilict building. Once inside it wasn't much better, there was a computer in the lobby (more like a front room) for internet access that was from the 90's and looked horribly ugly. The receptionist was polite which was the only thing the hotel had going for it. The lift was terribly small (4 people max) and took forever (only 6 floors to the hotel). Once in my room I was comfronted with exposed wiring, TV not working and 2 coat hangers for my 6 shirts! It was truely awful. When I asked for an iron, that's all I got, no ironing board was available so I had to use the corner of my bed. I was travelling with work and had the hotel booked for me, I have made an internal complaint at work so that no one has to go through what I went through, hotels like this need to be closed up. The tip of the iceberg was the baggage holding room for when you'd like to leave your baggage for half a day after checking out, it was a small room on the 6th floor, and the lift was far too busy with breakfast goers, so I had to walk it up there, ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: StephColex
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week in July 2008 and were very impressed. The location couldn't be better, a few minutes walk from Adenauer-Platz U-Bahn and Kurfurstendamm - the main shopping street. It's in quite a quiet neighbourhood with good facilities nearby and feels very safe. Breakfast was nice with a good selection of hot and cold foods - the slices of cake at breakfast time was a bit of a novelty for us! Reception were very helpful with any queries we had and made us feel very welcome. The rooms were more than adequate, en-suite bathroom, safe, tv, comfy beds etc. Not luxury, but nice all the same. Would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting a reasonably cheap but nice hotel. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: calamaestra
Reviews.Content: The Agon Franke is located just a few minutes walk from Adenauerplatz U-Bahn station. You can take the 109 bus directly from Tegel airport to this station as well. The hotel is sort of old fashioned - you get real keys. The room and bathroom sizes are adequate. The breakfast is good with both hot and cold choices. The hotel staff was wonderful and they spoke English which was a plus. This is not a complaint, but the sheets and comforter were attached in this sort of uberblanket. I would stay here again for this price. The elevator is small, just take the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great for budget city break”
Reviews.Author: JFML
Reviews.Content: Good budget hotel, clean rooms basic but with plenty of space and wardrobe space etc. Excellent chambermaid service each day. Good breakfast each morning with usual selection of breads and rolls with cheeses, hams, jams etc, also with hot options (eggs, sausage etc) and cereals. PLenty available. Good location for Adenauerplatz U bahn - about 5 mins walk, and 5 mins from Ku'dam. Quiet side street so not much traffic at night so windows can be left open. Cheap supermarket (and Lidl's) round the corner with other small shops as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: canerandagio
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivers all you need, in typical German fashion. No frills, no luxury, nothing more than one would expect from a three star hotel, but nothing less either, above average quality for a very reasonable rate. Room was clean, large enough, bathroom was adequate, with a good shower. Breakfast was also adequate, with a good variety served from 6:30 am. I didn't give it 5 stars because check-in was only possible from 2pm and the lobby and stairs could benefit from a make-up, but if you go further you'll find that things improve when you walk into the room and when you go down for breakfast. Staff was friendly and location was also good, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: RiaTenburyWells
Reviews.Content: Fourteen of us had a long weekend away in Berlin and stayed at the Agon Franke for 4 nights. The hotel was perfectly adequate for a 3 star hotel. It is situated in a residential area, about a mile from the main centre, so very quiet and little outside noise. The underground is a 5 minute brisk walk, and main shopping road into the centre passes a good half hour of walking with lots of window shopping along the way. Buses to the main attractions are passing all the time. The room and bathroom were both very clean, although there was no bath. The towels were almost torture, they were so hard! The shower was powerful, although there was little hot water at peak times (boiling hot off peak though). There was a television in the room (but only CNN in English). There is a personal safe in the wardrobe and a hairdryer in the bathroom. Adequate storage space and lots of sockets. The breakfast buffet was very good. Unfortunately the hotel does not have a bar, or tea and coffee facilities in the room, although there are lots of bars and restaurants in the nearby vicinity offering food and drink until the early hours. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. I found out on the last day that you could order tea and coffee from reception at any time (for a fee). The hotel lift was very small and with 14 of us all on the 5th and 6th floors, it was either go up in shifts or take 10 or 12 flights of stairs (fine going down!!). All in all, quite a moderate hotel, no frills, but fine for putting your head down.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CalBristol
Reviews.Content: Looking for a reasonably priced and comfortable, quiet hotel in Berlin? Look no further than the Franke! Situated about 5 minutes walk from the Adenauerplatz U Bahn station, the hotel is situated in a mainly residential area. The outside looks a bit plain and grey but the foyer is bright and staff are welcoming and friendly. The rooms are a bit plain with older style furniture but well kept, the beds are comfortable and the room is spotlessly clean. Bathrooms are small but modern with bath/shower, hairdryer, etc. No mini bar (but the reception have cold drinks available) and no air con., but the windows all open and there is very little street noise at night. Each room has a small safe for your valuables. Rooms at the front look out onto the road and at the back onto a car park, gardens and apartment blocks. The breakfast buffet is very good and the breakfast room is bright and airy. No restaurant or bar in the hotel but there is a good bar/restaurant a very short walk from the hotel. Also the Ku'dam is full of restaurants, bars and cafe's of all descriptions, not to mention all the exclusive boutiques and shops! Recommended as a good base for sightseeing in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly, shabby and will never return!”
Reviews.Author: 998DUC
Reviews.Content: Upon research and after reading many reviews, my wife and I felt there were more positive than negative advisements about the Agon Franke in this site. Unfortunately, after attending the hotel, we now know the truth. I have a feeling that those whose reviews praised this hotel probably have not been to any average scale (3 star) hotels or resorts. Or, they just had to settle for the Franke due to either overbooking to a hotel of their first choice or lack just the lack of research on their end. If attending this hotel don't have any expectations. My wife and I are fairly experienced travelers and found this hotel the worst place of stay. It definitely does not classify as a 3 star hotel. We actually believe it should not be rated at all. It should be a "Walk In, First come first serve" hotel. The breakfast is basically a continental breakfast with the addition of scrambled eggs and hotdogs. Not appealing at all. Breakfast out everyday was a better choice. Cleanliness was average. But when you think about of it, it must be extremely hard to keep an already beat up shabby place clean...........Applause to the cleaning crew who do their best to keep this deteriorating place alive. The help (reception/front desk) were not friendly and acted extremely rude. When asked for something, they always had some remark back which made us feel uncertain. The food preparation/dining room clean up help were also not friendly either. When you say "hello, good morning", you were just ignored. They did not look very happy or acted like they enjoy doing their job. Resultingly, and unlike our norm, we have no photos of the hotel and or crew and would just rather like to forget our experience at the Agon Franke. Of course we will never return! One suggestion to those who are so quick and willing to send in their reviews. Maybe one should wait until adequate experience is reached to share such reviews. When praising a 3 star hotel, you might want to attend a few prior to publicizing your report. Please realize, some of the public do appreciate the honesty, bad or good, in these reviews in helping with the fnal decisions made.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: boardmeeting
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Agon Franke for about a week in August 2006, and for a budget hotel, it wasn't bad at all. The breakfast was enough to fill our stomachs, and we had a room facing the parking lot, so we slept like babies. I found the room to be sizable enough for two persons, and it was kept clean for the whole stay. The metro is about 5-10 minutes away from the hotel, and from there we could reach all of Berlin. I'd recommend this hotel for those travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Basic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ManchesterAimee
Reviews.Content: Read some of the reviews for this hotel and was a little worried that we had booked the wrong thing - How wrong could I be! We went for a weekend city break to banish our January blues, and this trip definately did the trick! The hotel was basic, but it was very clean, the beds were really comfy, the staff were friendly and helpfull, and the breakfast was good too! Exactely what you want for a city break - I would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BritHolidayMaker
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a three night stay at the Agon Franke, pretty good. The room was clean, mine was a single room but the size was good. The room has a tv, phone (no tea/coffee making facilities). The bathroom was clean and towels provided. But sadly no bath, just a shower. Another reviewer mentioned carpets and the poor state of repair they were in. Well I'm pleased to say it looks like the hotel has been completely recarpeted. Even the stairs, brand new carpets! The location of the hotel is very good, approximately five minutes walk to Adenauer Platz Ubahn - tip to get a travel pass like the citytourpass (14.90 euros for two days). On balance excellent value for money, basic accommodation but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: tripperAuckland
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel we have stayed at. We knew that it was a 3 star hotel and knew what this rating meant. What we didn't know was that the hotel is shabby and poorly maintained. Carpet in the stair well is tattered and is in a dangerous condition. The first room we occupied had a broken shower fitting and the covering was falling of the bathroom ceiling. The room was very small. On our request we were given another room which was of adequate size and in better condition, although the wash basin tap and other bathroom fittings were broken. The breakfast was very adequate and the staff did their best to be helpful in a far from adequate environment. To summarise, this hotel is tired, shabby and poorly maintained. We would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, but not the best location”
Reviews.Author: CharlieDC
Reviews.Content: Booked this through expedia at a very cheap rate. Hotels in Berlin are extremely cheap, but very nice. We were 3 American college students on Thanksgiving Break,staying in 2 rooms. The staff was friendly and spoke English well. The breakfast was surprisingly tasty and filling - a great way to start off our days in Berlin. The rooms were simple, but sufficient and clean. Our only complaint was the location - we wish we had stayed closer to some bars or some nightlife. The underground was not very close, but the bus stop that took you to ZooGarden (major transfer point) was only only a few blocks away and then there was no more than a 5 minute wait for a 10 minute bus ride. Overall nice choice, but will pick a different neighborhood next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: gilbertcr
Reviews.Content: If you go by the description on their Web site: (----) It sounds great and you may be dissapointed. It really is one star basic and depending what you paid that may be all you expect - which is fine. eg. 'Our breakfast buffet It begins with our international breakfast buffet that truly leaves nothing to be desired and guarantees you an individual start to your day. Whether you prefer to eat light French, proper English or sporty and vegetarian, in Hotel AGON Franke you can fashion the first meal of the day according to your own personal taste.' 'proper English' - err no, scrambled eggs and mini frankfurter sausages is the closest you'll find. But the breakfast offering on the whole is adequate and plentiful, if not the gastronomic delights aluded to. eg. 'If, on the other hand, you've had an eventful day and you prefer a bit of understatement, you will find our hotel bar to be just the place, with its warm and relaxing atmosphere and an exquisite selection of drinks.' What bar? It doesn't have one. The location is OK too, On the bus route 110 which takes you to the Zoological Gardens about a 10 minute ride, which is a transport hub for travel into the city. Or a short walk (about 5 minutes) to Ardenauer Platz on a main route for buses, U7 underground and the bus route from Tegel Airport (bus route 109)

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: simmo100
Reviews.Content: appears from the outside to be a bit dour but once in the room it is very clean and friendly. Breakfast served from 6.30 to 10am and is cold buffet style with scrambled and boiled eggs along with sausages, meats, cheese etc. Reception were very friendly when required. No safe in the rooms but a safe box can be used in the reception area. No drink facilities in the room. Excellent for links to transport and only a 3 minute walk to the Ku'damm.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to put your head down”
Reviews.Author: bluemoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the beginning of June, just as the World Cup kicked off. Good advice from a TripAdvisor member on how to get there was much appreciated! The 110 bus does indeed drop you outside the front door (near enough). The receptionist spoke good English and we checked in a couple of hours earlier than they say but everything was ok. The lift is small but gets you there! The room was bright and airy and quite modern looking. The bed was 2 singles pushed together with a thin duvet. We were in a middle of a mini-heatwave but the room was more than comfortable and did not feel at all too hot. The bathroom was impressive in terms of it's size and cleanliness and the shower was hot and powerful! There was a quite a large tv with CNN but no tv/coffee although this seems to be a mainland Europe thing rather than a fault of the hotel. Breakfast was fine and had tea, coffee, rolls, cereal, fruit, ham and cheeses. More than enough to see you until lunch-time! The location was good as it was off the main hustle-bustle but close enough to the the U-Bahn and the main shopping street (about 15 min walk) if you wanted to walk. We didn't go back to the hotel apart from to sleep as there was so much to do in Berlin. Overall this hotel was a good base for a busy couple of days in Berlin and we would definatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my boyfriend and we thought it was a wonderful value. The staff was friendly, helpful, and spoke English. I found the rooms to be quite comfortable and although some people have mentioned noise, it was very quiet during our stay. The breakfast was good and filling and getting around the city was easy from this location. Also, getting to any of the airports is very easy using either the bus or the Ubahn. It was probably the cheapest and one of the most comfortable hotels that I have stayed in during my European travels and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Agon Franke hotel, with my son, for three nights, 31st March - 3rd April 2006 and had a room on the sixth (top) floor. The bathroom was clean and recently tiled. The room was furnished adequately. The bed comfortable and the room TV had CNN news coverage. There was no Tea/coffee making facilities or shaving point. The staff were very helpful and friendly. A safe box facility available free of charge and leaving your luggage for a late flight was catered for without fuss. Breakfast was from 6.30 -10.00am and was both plentiful and adequate in terms of choice. The best way to find the Hotel is as folows - On arrival at Schonefield Airport, purchase a Welcome card at the airport newsagent. Use this card to take the S9 train to the Zoolological Gardens stop. Alight from the train and then take the No. 110 bus ( again using your welcome card) as this bus will drop you at the door of the Hotal Franke. (it is the top after Adenauer Platz)

Reviews.Title: “Franke-ly speaking, a very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: andyvid
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at Franke, an old fashioned hotel that offered a clean and quiet room, a large bathroom, friendly staff and a very rich breakfast (comprising of scrambled eggs, a vast selection of ham and cheese, tomatoes and cucumbers and even chocolate/vanilla cream!). At 260 euros for 3 nights in a triple room, the hotel was quite a bargain: lovers of shopping will be delighted, as it is just 5-10 minutes away from the Kurfunstendamm street, but I would recommend it also to other tourists, who will be able - within the same time of walk - to reach the Adenauer Platz U-Bahn station (and from there be in a breeze in every other point of Berlin or Potsdam).

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: avourlid
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the hotel was very clean, the staff extremely helpful and polite and spoke good english. On the negative side, the rooms are very old fashioned and basic (e.g. no fridge) and the overall ambience isn't inspiring. Would recommend it if you got it for a good price but definitively isn't worth paying over the top for it.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned but good”
Reviews.Author: Elvis2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Agon Franke for 2 nights - Friday and Saturday and found it stuck in the 1970's in terms of decor and amenties but otherwise pretty comfortable. The room was clean and the bathroom new. But there are no hi-tech gadgets in the room - basic tv , no fridge, old key doorlock etc. But its certainly good enough for a hot shower and good nights sleep. Speaking of good nights sleep there was some noise on our Friday night there - from some youths standing outside the hotel - but this ended at around 11pm so didnt cause any problems. The breakfast was buffet style focussed on bread, cold meats and cheeses but included cereals, fruit, cake etc. Quite adequate. From a location point of view its pretty easy to get to from the airport. If you prefer a scenic (and I think quickest) route take bus 109 which stops at Adenaeurplatz U bahn (25 mins) and its about a 5 minute walk from there. The hotel is just off the lower end of the Kudamm so there are some shops and restaurants around, although we found we had to travel to get to a better selection. Most of the sights and restaurants are in the Mitte area which is about 30mins by U bahn from the hotel. There is a small supermarket a few minutes walk up the road from the hotel. I do think that the hotel was value for money and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay, Mario”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 night in the hotel Franke and feel very well. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The brakfast is a rich buffet where you can eat as much as you want. The hotel is a perfect starting point for excursions through Berlin. We enjoyed it very much and would like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “nice, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay with my boy-friend for two nights in hotel Franke. We had much fun in Berlin. Our room was small but clean and the staff was very friendly. Breakfast excellent. Next time we want stay in Hotel Franke again.

Reviews.Title: “Very hot weekend”
Reviews.Author: 7eric7
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Franke Hotel for the weekend. Found the hotel very easily after a 50 minute s bahn ride to Charlottenburg and a ten minute walk. Staff very helpful and welcoming. Room farely small but clean and comfortable (or it would have been if it wasnt so hot). Berlin was in the middle of a heatwave 33 degrees centigrade, and even hotter in the room. Fear not though, there is an electrical store (Bahaus) just round the corner on the Ku'dam where we brought a fan for just under 11 euros. The breakfast was excellent, served in a night bright breakfast room. Would stay there again in the winter, but NOT in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “NOISE FROM YOUTHS”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel handy for centre of Berlin and functional. Next door is a youth club which closes at 11pm. We stayed 3 nights and on two consecutive nights the youths, male and female, caused disorder where they played music, shouted and walked along the roofs of parked cars. We had NO sleep until 4am both nights. Only a night porter on during night and next morning staff shrugged their shoulders when we complained only saying they (the staff) did not live in this area. To be fair area seems ok but spoils holiday when you don't get any sleep. Berlin is a lovely City and I would go again but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scouser007
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June of this year along with 11 others. The hotel is situated just off the K'dam in a very quite road. The rooms were very clean and consited of a bathroom, wardrobe, desk and twin/double beds. The maids came in every day to 'tidy up' and change the towels. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. We paid 48 Euros per room a night which included cold buffett breakfast. The breakfast was better than it sounds, there was plenty to eat and was constantly being refreshed. Everything that you could think of cheeses, different types of breads, cereals, yoghurts, fruit and eggs (boiled or scrambled), along with fresh juices and coffee. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. Very clean, central to the main street (K'dam) and handy for the underground or buses. If you are staying here and arriving at the zoo gardens station I would suggest that you don't walk, it is a good 15-20 mins walk and if you have luggage not a good idea. From the station you can get a taxi which costs approx 7 Euros, so well worth it. You can also get a 109 bus but I'm not too sure what the name of the stop is that you get off at is called. The walk from the zoo station is great for a stroll, you pass all the luxury shops, gucci, chanel, rolex etc., the window shopping is great. There is a lovely Italian restaurant just around the corner from the hotel, come out of the hotel and turn left, left and left. Fantastic pizzas and specials and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Owenz
Reviews.Content: The hotel Franke is on a quiet side street off the middle of the Ku'damm. It was very convenient to shopping, the bus to the airport and the U and S Bahn. It was a bit of a walk to the Adeneaurplatz train station (10-12 min.). The rooms were clean. They had a pretty good breakfast with lots of breads and spreads. The staff were very helpful and even sold me stamps for post cards which were great. The locks are very old and the size of the keys are bit cumbersome. The showers are part of the tub with small wall and difficult to use being a taller, bigger person. Very clean. Beds linens were a little stiff (not exactly 200 count sheets).
